hipi.image
Class FloatImage

java.lang.Object
  hipi.image.FloatImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparator<BinaryComparable>, RawComparator<BinaryComparable>, Writable
public class FloatImage
extends Object
implements Writable, RawComparator<BinaryComparable>

A 2D image represented as an array of floats. A FloatImage consists of a 2D array of pixel values represented as Java floats in addition to the image's spatial resoultion (width and height) and number of bands (color channels). FloatImage supports simple image operations like retrieving and setting individual pixel values, cropping, scaling, and adding two FloatImages together.

The hipi.image.io package provides classes for reading (decoding) and writing (encoding) FloatImage objects in various compressed and uncompressed image formats such as JPEG.

Specified by:

equals in class Object
Returns:
True if the two images are found to deviate by less than 1.0/255.0 at each pixel and across each band, false otherwise.

readFields

public void readFields(DataInput input)
                throws IOException
Reads an image stored in a simple uncompressed binary format. The first three bytes are the width, height, and number of bands, followed by an array of floating point values (32 bits per channel) of the image pixel data in raster scan order.

Specified by:
readFields in interface Writable
Parameters:
input - Interface for reading bytes from a binary stream.
Throws:
IOException

Produces a string representation of the image. Concatenates image dimensions with pixel data in lexicographic order.

compare

public int compare(byte[] byte_array1,
                   int start1,
                   int length1,
                   byte[] byte_array2,
                   int start2,
                   int length2)
Compare method from the RawComparator interface. This method enables faster sorting than the standard Comparator interface. For a discussion, see Hadoop: The Definitive Guide. In short, this method avoids deserializing the entire FloatImage object before performing the comparison. Because the first few bytes store the image dimensions, this function only reads this small segment at the beginning of the array and uses these sizes to compare the two images. TODO: Ensure that the second and fifth parameters define the correct starting offset.

Specified by:
compare in interface RawComparator<BinaryComparable>
Returns:
An integer result of the comparison.

compare

public int compare(BinaryComparable o1,
                   BinaryComparable o2)
Compare method from the Comparator interface. This method reads both BinaryComparable objects into byte arrays and calls compare(byte[], int, int, byte[], int, int).

Specified by:
compare in interface Comparator<BinaryComparable>
Returns:
An integer result of the comparison.
See Also:
